blas_impl:
- mkl
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
libblas:
- 3.9.* *netlib
mkl_devel:
- '2025'
numpy:
- '2'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
Solves convex cone programs via operator splitting.
Can solve: linear programs (LPs), second-order cone programs (SOCPs),
semidefinite programs (SDPs), exponential cone programs (ECPs),
and power cone programs (PCPs), or problems with any combination of
those cones.
about.summary: Python interface for SCS, which solves convex cone problems

name: scs

about.description:
Solves convex cone programs via operator splitting.
Can solve: linear programs (LPs), second-order cone programs (SOCPs),
semidefinite programs (SDPs), exponential cone programs (ECPs),
and power cone programs (PCPs), or problems with any combination of
those cones.
about.summary: Python interface for SCS, which solves convex cone problems

about.description:
Solves convex cone programs via operator splitting.
Can solve: linear programs (LPs), second-order cone programs (SOCPs),
semidefinite programs (SDPs), exponential cone programs (ECPs),
and power cone programs (PCPs), or problems with any combination of
those cones.
about.summary: Python interface for SCS, which solves convex cone problems

raw_meta_yaml:
context:
  version: "3.2.11"
  build_number: 0
  # strip netlib constraint because we're overriding blas_impl here
  blas_pin_no_impl: "${{ (libblas | split(' '))[0] if libblas else '*' }}"

package:
  name: scs
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  - url: https://github.com/bodono/scs-python/archive/refs/tags/${{ version }}.tar.gz
    sha256: fa753f507201f1884198af51d49c0b5c80d52a064cac51be3e7be6ad5ab990f6
  # include submodule (not in github tarball due to dear-github/dear-github#214)
  - git: https://github.com/cvxgrp/scs.git
    rev: c8297172633bcb3a10d4781a19d4769ce5282d29
    target_directory: scs_source
  - git: https://github.com/python/pythoncapi-compat.git
    rev: fde4d3457d7c1e6f7d09afeae5afd2218fbb2cae
    target_directory: scs/pythoncapi-compat

build:
  number: ${{ build_number }}
  string: ${{ ("mkl" if blas_impl == "mkl" else "default") }}_py${{ python | version_to_buildstring }}h${{ hash }}_${{ build_number }}
  script:
    - if: unix
      then:
        - if: blas_impl == "mkl"
          then:
            - MESON_ARGS="-Dlink_mkl=true ${MESON_ARGS}"
        - python -m pip install . -vv -Csetup-args=${MESON_ARGS// / -Csetup-args=}
      else:
        - set "EXTRA="
        - if: win and blas_impl == "mkl"
          then:
            - set "EXTRA=-Csetup-args=-Dlink_mkl=true"
        - python -m pip install . -vv %EXTRA%

requirements:
  build:
    - if: build_platform != target_platform
      then:
        - libblas ${{ blas_pin_no_impl }}
        - liblapack ${{ blas_pin_no_impl }}
        - libblas * *${{ blas_impl }}
        - liblapack * *${{ blas_impl }}
        - python
        - cross-python_${{ target_platform }}
        - numpy
        - meson-python
    - pkg-config
    - ${{ compiler('c') }}
    - ${{ stdlib('c') }}
  host:
    - libblas ${{ blas_pin_no_impl }}
    - liblapack ${{ blas_pin_no_impl }}
    - libblas * *${{ blas_impl }}
    - liblapack * *${{ blas_impl }}
    - if: blas_impl == "mkl"
      then:
        - mkl-devel
    - python
    - meson-python
    - pip
    - numpy
  run:
    - python
    - scipy >=0.13.2
    - if: blas_impl == "mkl"
      then:
        - libblas * *${{ blas_impl }}
        - liblapack * *${{ blas_impl }}
  run_constraints:
    # avoid installing incompatible cvxpy
    - cvxpy >1.1.15

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
        - scs
        - scs._scs_direct
        - scs._scs_indirect
        - if: blas_impl == "mkl"
          then:
            - scs._scs_mkl
  - requirements:
      run:
        - pytest
    files:
      source:
        - test/
    script:
      - if: not ppc64le
        then:
          - pytest test/ -v
        else:
          # NOTE: test suite is skipped on ppc due to bugs in QEMU code that cause
          # CI to fail, even though the tests should run through on native hardware
          - echo "Skipping tests on ppc64le due to QEMU bugs"

about:
  homepage: https://github.com/bodono/scs-python
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Python interface for SCS, which solves convex cone problems
  description: |
    Solves convex cone programs via operator splitting.
    Can solve: linear programs (LPs), second-order cone programs (SOCPs),
    semidefinite programs (SDPs), exponential cone programs (ECPs),
    and power cone programs (PCPs), or problems with any combination of
    those cones.
  repository: https://github.com/bodono/scs-python

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - djsutherland
    - h-vetinari
    - wshanks

about.description:
Solves convex cone programs via operator splitting.
Can solve: linear programs (LPs), second-order cone programs (SOCPs),
semidefinite programs (SDPs), exponential cone programs (ECPs),
and power cone programs (PCPs), or problems with any combination of
those cones.
about.summary: Python interface for SCS, which solves convex cone problems
